text: Brad J. Dye, Jr. (December 20, 1933 â€“ July 1, 2018) was an American politician. He was born in Charleston, Mississippi. Dye served three 4-year terms as 27th Lieutenant Governor of Mississippi from 1980 until 1992. He served under William Winter, William Allain and Ray Mabus. Dye was a member of the Democratic Party. Dye died of respiratory failure on July 1, 2018 in Ridgeland, Mississippi at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== * Oral History Project * Category:1933 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Lieutenant Governors of Mississippi Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
